urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2’s tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire’s aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

urls.title: Is the Environment Agency doing its job?
urls.description: Guy Linley-Adams, Solicitor to Salmon & Trout Conservation, shares the findings from their new report on the role of the Environment Agency & why greater investment is needed to make our rivers, lakes, and streams healthy by 2027.

@reacctionary @hayulls @Lucy_Lapwing @LGSpace @Buzz_dont_tweet @DandelionAppre1 @Love_plants @wildflower_hour @WildFlowerSoc @BiodiversitySoS @MeadowInGarden @DaveGoulson @RewildingB @banburyfm @banburynews @Cherwellcouncil @TownEvents @EnvAgency The thing is these contractors come round and spray on bare ground as long as they get paid and in a childrens play area too.
It's wrong on every level and people need to stop looking at wild flowers as weeds, an attitude that is promoted by the media.
We have assessed the capping works at Walley's Quarry and have made clear further actions to manage odours. Please see our statement. https://t.co/NcqGMajjYd
I am hearing that @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest may have finally seen sense!? @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife https://t.co/fAB6uuBlCW

@hayulls @JWillson1 @Lucy_Lapwing @LGSpace @Buzz_dont_tweet @DandelionAppre1 @Love_plants @wildflower_hour @WildFlowerSoc @BiodiversitySoS @MeadowInGarden @DaveGoulson @RewildingB @banburyfm @banburynews @Cherwellcouncil @TownEvents @EnvAgency It is also a reportable incident as far as Health and Safety Executive are concerned (but I wish you luck going down that route). Councils quite often employ contractors to do this sort of work, often sub-contracted out in turn. Makes it hard to find a responsible person...
People have to fight not only polluting industries but now also the @EnvAgency and their own government @DefraGovUK to stop the rot. How on earth did that happen? https://t.co/oN4HCpp52u
